page.title: 01WITHAM, THE TOWN
page.content: WITHAM is a small town lying between Chelmsford and Colchester on the A12. The original Town was in the Saxon Burgh containing St. Nicolas' church ( The Victorian Railway builders cut through this in 1842). Evidence has been found on the south east side of a Roman Temple(Witham Lodge Estate) and a Romano British village. The main street, Newland Street has its origins in the lands given to the Knights Templar. Many buildings have Georgian Fronts resulting from the discovery of a Mineral spring by Dr. Taverner in 17.C.It also developed some importance as a staging postfor the coaches travelling to the East Coast. In 1965 the town became a London Overspill town, offering new homes for people from London.
